com.datastax.oss.dsbulk.executor.api.listener

Class MetricsCollectingExecutionListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datastax.oss.dsbulk.executor.api.listener.MetricsCollectingExecutionListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExecutionListener

    public class MetricsCollectingExecutionListener
extends Object
implements ExecutionListener
    A ExecutionListener that records useful metrics about the ongoing bulk operations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      • getRegistry

        public com.codahale.metrics.MetricRegistry getRegistry()

      • getTotalStatementsTimer

        public com.codahale.metrics.Timer getTotalStatementsTimer()
        Returns a Timer for total statement executions (successful and failed).

        A batch statement is counted as one single statement. If that's not what you want, you are probably looking for getTotalWritesTimer().

        Returns:
        a Timer for total statement executions (successful and failed).

      • getSuccessfulStatementsCounter

        public com.codahale.metrics.Counter getSuccessfulStatementsCounter()
        Returns a Counter for successful statement executions.

        A batch statement is counted as one single statement. If that's not what you want, you are probably looking for getSuccessfulWritesCounter().

        Returns:
        a Counter for successful statement executions.

      • getFailedStatementsCounter

        public com.codahale.metrics.Counter getFailedStatementsCounter()
        Returns a Counter for failed statement executions.

        A batch statement is counted as one single statement. If that's not what you want, you are probably looking for getFailedWritesCounter().

        Returns:
        a Counter for failed statement executions.

      • getTotalReadsTimer

        public com.codahale.metrics.Timer getTotalReadsTimer()
        Returns a Timer that evaluates the duration of execution of reads, both successful and failed.
        Returns:
        a Timer that evaluates the duration of execution of reads, both successful and failed.

      • getSuccessfulReadsCounter

        public com.codahale.metrics.Counter getSuccessfulReadsCounter()

        Returns:

      • getFailedReadsCounter

        public com.codahale.metrics.Counter getFailedReadsCounter()
        Returns a Counter that evaluates the duration of execution of failed reads.
        Returns:
        a Counter that evaluates the duration of execution of failed reads.

      • getTotalWritesTimer

        public com.codahale.metrics.Timer getTotalWritesTimer()
        Returns a Timer that evaluates the duration of execution of writes, both successful and failed.

        A batch statement is counted as many times as the number of child statements it contains. If that's not what you want, you are probably looking for getTotalStatementsTimer().

        Returns:
        a Timer that evaluates the duration of execution of writes, both successful and failed.

      • getSuccessfulWritesCounter

        public com.codahale.metrics.Counter getSuccessfulWritesCounter()
        Returns a Counter that evaluates the duration of execution of successful writes.

        A batch statement is counted as many times as the number of child statements it contains. If that's not what you want, you are probably looking for getSuccessfulStatementsCounter().

        Returns:
        a Counter that evaluates the duration of execution of successful writes.

      • getFailedWritesCounter

        public com.codahale.metrics.Counter getFailedWritesCounter()
        Returns a Counter that evaluates the duration of execution of failed writes.

        A batch statement is counted as many times as the number of child statements it contains. If that's not what you want, you are probably looking for getFailedStatementsCounter().

        Returns:
        a Counter that evaluates the duration of execution of failed writes.

      • getTotalReadsWritesTimer

        public com.codahale.metrics.Timer getTotalReadsWritesTimer()
        Returns a Timer that evaluates the duration of execution of all operations, including reads and writes, both successful and failed.
        Returns:
        a Timer that evaluates the duration of execution of all operations.

      • getSuccessfulReadsWritesCounter

      • getInFlightRequestsCounter

        public com.codahale.metrics.Counter getInFlightRequestsCounter()
        Returns a Counter that evaluates the number of current in-flight requests, i.e. the number of uncompleted futures waiting for a response from the server.
        Returns:
        a Counter that evaluates the number of current in-flight requests.

      • getBytesSentMeter

        public Optional<com.codahale.metrics.Meter> getBytesSentMeter()
        Returns a Meter that evaluates the total number of bytes sent so far.

        Note that this counter's value is an estimate of the actual amount of data sent; it might be inaccurate or even zero, if the data size cannot be calculated.

        Returns:
        a Meter that evaluates the total number of bytes sent so far.

      • getBytesReceivedMeter

        public Optional<com.codahale.metrics.Meter> getBytesReceivedMeter()
        Returns a Meter that evaluates the total number of bytes received so far.

        Note that this counter's value is an estimate of the actual amount of data received; it might be inaccurate or even zero, if the data size cannot be calculated.

        Returns:
        a Meter that evaluates the total number of bytes received so far.

      • onRowReceived

        public void onRowReceived(Row row,
                          ExecutionContext context)
        Description copied from interface: ExecutionListener
        Called when a row has been successfully received. Applicable only for reads.

        Note: this method is called when the row is effectively read and emitted to downstream subscribers, which might be later than the moment when it was made available by the driver.

        Specified by:
        onRowReceived in interface ExecutionListener
        Parameters:
        row - the row.
        context - the local request execution context.
